image.altText: Steven Miles is smiling as he steps off a BCC bus.

props.synopsis: Party leaders hoping to win the votes of Queenslanders blitzed the state over the first week of official election campaigning.

title.children: A fumble and bold promises: Week one of Queensland's election campaign

image.altText: A man wearing a white shirt and tie standing in front of trees.

props.synopsis: In an interview with the ABC, the Queensland opposition leader sheds light on his decision to keep his family out of the public spotlight, and talks about his pitch for the state's future.

title.children: 'I learnt a lot from my stint in politics': David Crisafulli opens up about family and his bid to be premier

image.altText: A composite image of two Queensland politicians.

props.synopsis: Queensland's election campaign is already one week down, with three to go.

title.children: All the slips, stumbles and head injuries of Queensland's election campaign so far

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt sits in his car holding up his phone with the uber app on it

props.synopsis: The best friend of a slain Uber driver has described the Queensland justice system as "broken" after learning the teenagers responsible for the killing could be released from jail in less than 10 years.

title.children: Teen passengers who killed Queensland Uber driver sentenced in court

image.altText: A woman and man with sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the teenager, now aged 19, argue extraneous and extensive pre-trial publicity of Ms Lovell's death could prejudice a jury.

title.children: Second teenager accused of murdering Queensland mother Emma Lovell to face judge-only trial

image.altText: Blonde woman smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Psychologist Frances Crawford, 49, was found dead at the bottom of a retaining wall at her property west of Brisbane in the early hours of July 30.

title.children: Police appeal for information about the marriage of ride-on mower murder victim

image.altText: Police in uniform and hazmat suits outside the unit blocks. One officer talks on the phone.

props.synopsis: A North Queensland man has been arrested for allegedly murdering his older housemate. The 64-year-old was found dead on Wednesday afternoon by paramedics doing a welfare check.

title.children: North Queensland man arrested and charged over death of flatmate

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Teens already on social media could be exempt from a ban under options being canvassed by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

title.children: PM opens the door to softer ban for teens on social media

image.altText: A woman speaks outside court.

props.synopsis: Queensland Opposition Leader David Crisafulli has pegged his political future to reducing victim of crime numbers within four years if the LNP wins the October 26 state election.

title.children: Sister of murdered Gold Coast woman Kelly Wilkinson says LNP's DV tracker plan is 'difference between life and death'

image.altText: A black and white cow.

props.synopsis: Everything is bigger in Texas, even bird flu amongst cattle. But while there are concerns for Australian dairy farmers they say things are in a state of alert rather than alarm.

title.children: 'Alert but not alarmed': Australian dairy farmers react to fears of deadly strain of bird flu

image.altText: Mid shot of a woman and a man addressing the media.

props.synopsis: Against warnings from health, justice and Aboriginal groups, the NT government says it will fulfil its election promise and return the age of criminal responsibility back to 10 this year.

title.children: As advocates push to raise the criminal age to 14, the NT is lowering it to 10

image.altText: A close up of a man's face with cuts and bruises.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Liberal National Party has accepted a $17,500 donation from a party official alleged to have assaulted a young Indigenous woman and her husband.

title.children: LNP accepted $17,500 donation from party official being investigated over alleged assault

image.altText: A large four-metre crocodile sits on the sand bank.

props.synopsis: An online influencer has come under fire for boasting about feeding a four-metre crocodile in Far North Queensland just a month after penalties for interfering with the reptiles were drastically increased.

title.children: Influencer under investigation over wild croc feeding video

image.altText: a man talking

props.synopsis: The ABC speaks to LNP justice spokesman Tim Nicholls about his party's "adult crime adult time" approach to youth offenders.

title.children: Will 'adult crime, adult time' reduce youth offending?

image.altText: Flames coming out of a village at night.

props.synopsis: The US military says it conducted 15 strikes on Friday against targets linked to Iran-aligned Houthi fighters in Yemen, while an overnight Israeli air strike severed a major highway connecting Lebanon with Syria

title.children: Biden warns Israel against Iran oil strikes, US military says it hit 15 Houthi targets in Yemen

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese, both wearing thick-rimmed glasses and looking stern.

props.synopsis: The reality of the Middle East conflict is that of an ever-widening fight between two terrorist organisations and an increasingly militant state that is ignoring international calls for restraint, including from its most powerful ally.

title.children: Peter Dutton says the PM has put Australia 'at odds' with its allies on Israel. The truth is far more complicated

props.synopsis: Ahmad Sadeghi made remarks on social media late last month, the day Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli air strike.

title.children: Kylie Moore-Gilbert, detained by Iran for two years, says 'inflammatory' ambassador should be expelled

image.altText: A solar system on a rooftop at sunset.

props.synopsis: Solar businesses across the country are owed millions of dollars for work they have done as part of Australia's flagship green power scheme. But it's not customers owing them money. It's the middlemen, sitting at the heart of the financial plumbing behind it.

title.children: In the shadows of the billion-dollar solar industry, 'cowboys' are drawn to huge profits with little oversight

image.altText: Wind turbines are set to dot the landscape in Victoria's west

props.synopsis: Barely five months after the federal government committed more than $22 billion over 10 years to boost green hydrogen as an alternative fuel, two major projects have hit the skids.

title.children: Is the government's green hydrogen policy already obsolete?

image.altText: Voters must now number every square on the ballot paper.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, Queensland Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: Queensland Votes 2024 — stay up to date with the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: A man in a pilot uniform sits in the cockpit, screens lit up in front, arm lifted

props.synopsis: The Royal Flying Doctor Service has opened a $30 million "one-of-a-kind" training facility in regional Queensland to attract more staff to the service.

title.children: New Flying Doctor aeromedical training academy ‘really important’ amid global pilot shortage

image.altText: A person in a long sleeved white collared shirt and black pants walks into the Reserve Bank of Australia as its doors slide open

props.synopsis: Australians are increasingly optimistic that cost of living pressures are about to ease and expect to receive an interest rate cut soon, according to new polling.

title.children: Hope a rate cut could be on the way as Aussies continue to cut down on costs

image.altText: A gas flare on an oil production platform in the Soroush oil fields is seen alongside an Iranian flag in the Persian Gulf, Iran

props.synopsis: Global oil prices have been falling until increased geopolitical tensions in the Middle East saw jumps this week. So what does that mean for Australia in coming weeks?

title.children: What happened to global oil prices this week? What does it mean for Australia's petrol prices?

image.altText: A race horse being ridden by a jockey sprints towards the finish line near a large green sign reading: "Singapore Turf Club."

props.synopsis: Horseracing will end in Singapore when The Turf Club holds its last meet before handing its land back to the government to build apartments to help with housing affordability issues in the city-state, which has one of the most expensive property markets in the world.

title.children: Singapore real estate prices are so shocking, the city-state is bulldozing this racecourse for the land

image.altText: Three woman climbing rocks with trees below.

props.synopsis: Invasive species experts have labelled the water mould Phytophthora the worst plant disease in Australia and it has now forced the closure of a popular mountain trail in the south-east Queensland hinterland.

title.children: Popular Glass House Mountains trail closed after authorities detect national biosecurity risk

image.altText: A middle-aged woman in a pantsuit sits on a bench in a field.

props.synopsis: A Queensland mayor has opened a fake train station in a town that has been waiting 18 years for the real one to be built.

title.children: Mayor opens fake train station after 18 years of planning purgatory

image.altText: Small red and white plane on beach

props.synopsis: A trainee pilot and instructor have landed a light plane on the sand of a popular Queensland beach after suffering difficulties shortly after take-off.

title.children: Light plane makes 'textbook' landing on popular beach after suspected engine failure

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands at a diplomatic event

props.synopsis: A Cambodian woman working as a maid in Malaysia has been deported to her homeland and subsequently arrested over comments she posted on social media criticising Cambodian government leaders.

title.children: Maid deported by Malaysia to Cambodia for criticising Cambodian leaders

image.altText: A rendering of PsiQuantum's Brisbane quantum computer

props.synopsis: Australia is making a billion-dollar bet on a "useful" quantum computer in the Queensland capital, but surprisingly few experts agree on what the nation will get in return for its investment.

title.children: Australia is bankrolling a $1b quantum computer in Brisbane. Big corporations will use it first

image.altText: Jarome Luai of the Panthers is tackled by Melbourne Storm players

props.synopsis: The NRL grand final is on tomorrow, which just happens to be the first day of daylight saving time in some states. Get the timing right so you can be on the couch in time for kick off.

title.children: What time is the 2024 NRL grand final? What about the women's match?

image.altText: Leon Bridges sitting on a chair with a denim shirt on, ring on pinkie finger, hand to chin, hair natural

props.synopsis: Grammy winner Leon Bridges has released a new album Leon, while announcing dates for his Australian tour. He shares songwriting credits with fellow Grammy winner John Mayer on the song When a Man Cries.

title.children: Leon Bridges on the Instagram Live that led to a songwriting session with John Mayer

image.altText: A shopping trolley full of essentials items like fruit, water, and eggs

props.synopsis: It's often cheaper to buy private label or "home brand" groceries. But they're also often more profitable for the supermarkets.

title.children: Home brand products are cheaper at the supermarket. But are they good value?

image.altText: aerial photo of island with blue water and clouds at the top

props.synopsis: After years of negotiations, the UK is giving up its sovereignty over a cluster of strategically important Indian Ocean islands. The move has led to criticism from Britain's Conservative opposition and some local Indigenous groups.

title.children: This tiny island chain has been under British control since 1814. That changed this week

image.altText: Australia's Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: The NACC confirms it conducted a raid on the premises at Parliament House, saying its investigation does not relate to a current or former politician.

title.children: Corruption watchdog conducts raid at Parliament House in relation to 'ongoing investigation'
